info.title: License Service API Documentation
info.description:
Centralized License Service API for Multi-Brand Ecosystem

This API provides a centralized service for managing licenses and entitlements across multiple brands in the group.one ecosystem. It acts as the single source of truth for license lifecycle and entitlements, allowing brand-specific systems to provision, update, and query licenses while enabling end-user products to activate and validate their usage.

## Key Features
- **Multi-tenant License Management**: Isolated brand environments with secure API access
- **License Lifecycle**: Full lifecycle management including creation, renewal, suspension, and cancellation
- **Seat Management**: Flexible seat allocation and tracking for products
- **Cross-Brand Access**: Unified view of licenses across all brands for authorized users
- **Instance Activation**: Track license activations for specific instances (sites, machines, etc.)

## Authentication
**Brand-facing endpoints** require authentication using the `X-Tenant: {BRAND_API_KEY}` header, where the API key is specific to each brand.

**Product-facing endpoints** (license activation, status checking) do not require authentication and are designed for end-user products to access directly.

## Rate Limiting
API requests are subject to rate limiting to ensure fair usage and system stability.

ActivateLicenseRequest.description:
Activate License Request

Validates the request data for activating a license for a specific instance.
This endpoint allows end-user products to activate licenses for their instances.

**Authentication**: This endpoint does not require authentication. It is designed for end-user products
to activate licenses without needing to authenticate with the system.
ActivateLicenseRequest.title: ActivateLicenseRequest

DeactivateLicenseRequest.description:
Deactivate License Request

Validates the request data for deactivating a license for a specific instance.
This endpoint allows end-user products to deactivate licenses, freeing up seats.

**Authentication**: This endpoint does not require authentication. It is designed for end-user products
to deactivate licenses without needing to authenticate with the system.
DeactivateLicenseRequest.title: DeactivateLicenseRequest

ForceDeactivateSeatsRequest.description:
Force Deactivate Seats Request

Validates the request data for forcefully deactivating license seats.
This endpoint allows brands to deactivate seats for administrative purposes.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires brand authentication using the `X-Tenant: {BRAND_API_KEY}` header.
The brand API key is automatically generated when a brand is created and can be found in the brands table.
ForceDeactivateSeatsRequest.title: ForceDeactivateSeatsRequest

RenewLicenseRequest.description:
Renew License Request

Validates the request data for renewing an existing license.
This endpoint allows brands to extend license expiration dates.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires brand authentication using the `X-Tenant: {BRAND_API_KEY}` header.
The brand API key is automatically generated when a brand is created and can be found in the brands table.
RenewLicenseRequest.title: RenewLicenseRequest

StoreLicenseKeyRequest.description:
Store License Key Request

Validates the request data for creating a new license key.
This endpoint allows brands to generate license keys for their customers.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires brand authentication using the `X-Tenant: {BRAND_API_KEY}` header.
The brand API key is automatically generated when a brand is created and can be found in the brands table.
StoreLicenseKeyRequest.title: StoreLicenseKeyRequest

StoreLicenseRequest.description:
Store License Request

Validates the request data for creating a new license.
This endpoint allows brands to provision licenses for their customers.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires brand authentication using the `X-Tenant: {BRAND_API_KEY}` header.
The brand API key is automatically generated when a brand is created and can be found in the brands table.
StoreLicenseRequest.title: StoreLicenseRequest
